name: Butter Chicken
steps: Marinate chicken in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, chili powder, and salt for 1 hour.
Grill or pan-fry the chicken until lightly browned.
In a pan, melt butter and sauté onions until golden.
Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
Add grilled chicken, cream, and fenugreek leaves.
Simmer for 10 minutes and serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Chole (Chickpea Curry)
steps: Boil soaked chickpeas until soft.
Heat oil, add cumin seeds, then sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add tomato puree and spices, cook until oil separates.
Add chickpeas and 1 cup water, simmer for 15 minutes.
Garnish with coriander and serve with rice or bhature.

name: Vegetable Samosa
short: Crispy pastry filled with spiced potatoes
steps: Mix flour, salt, and oil. Add water to form a stiff dough. Rest for 30 minutes.
Heat oil, add cumin seeds, then peas and mashed potatoes.
Add spices and cook for 5 minutes. Let filling cool.
Roll dough into circles, cut in half, form cones, and fill with potato mix.
Seal edges and deep-fry until golden brown.
Serve with tamarind or mint chutney.

name: Vegetable Biryani
short: Fragrant rice layered with spiced vegetables
steps: Cook rice until 70% done. Drain and set aside.
Sauté onions, add ginger-garlic paste, then tomatoes and spices.
Add vegetables and yogurt, cook until tender.
Layer rice and vegetable mix in a pot. Top with mint, coriander, and saffron milk.
Cover and cook on low heat for 15 minutes.
Serve hot with raita.

name: Kheer (Rice Pudding)
short: Sweet and creamy Indian rice dessert
steps: Wash and soak rice for 30 minutes.
Boil milk, add rice, and cook on low heat until rice is soft.
Stir frequently to avoid sticking.
Add sugar, cardamom, and nuts. Cook until thick and creamy.
Add raisins and simmer for 5 more minutes.
Serve warm or chilled.

name: Paneer Tikka
short: Grilled cottage cheese cubes marinated in spices
steps: Mix yogurt, spices, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, and salt to create marinade.
Add paneer cubes, onion, and bell pepper to marinade. Refrigerate for 1 hour.
Skewer marinated ingredients and grill or bake until golden.
Serve hot with mint chutney.

name: Rava Idli
steps: Roast semolina lightly and let it cool.
Prepare tempering with mustard seeds, dals, green chili, and add to semolina.
Mix in yogurt, salt, and baking soda. Let batter rest for 15 minutes.
Pour into idli molds and steam for 10–12 minutes.
Serve with coconut chutney and sambar.

name: Baingan Bharta
steps: Roast eggplants over flame until skin is charred. Peel and mash.
Heat oil, add cumin seeds, then sauté onions and ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomatoes, green chili, and spices. Cook until soft.
Add mashed eggplant and mix well. Cook for 5–7 minutes.
Garnish with coriander and serve with roti.

name: Dhokla
steps: Mix besan, yogurt, ginger, chili paste, and salt to form batter.
Add fruit salt just before steaming and mix gently.
Pour into greased tray and steam for 15–20 minutes.
Prepare tempering with mustard seeds, sesame seeds, and curry leaves.
Pour tempering over dhokla and cut into squares.
Serve with green chutney.

name: Fish Curry
short: Tangy and spicy coastal-style fish curry
steps: Marinate fish with turmeric and salt for 15 minutes.
Heat oil, sauté onions, ginger-garlic paste, and tomatoes.
Add spices and tamarind pulp. Cook until sauce thickens.
Add fish and simmer gently until cooked through.
Garnish with curry leaves and serve with rice.

name: Rasam
short: Spicy South Indian soup with tamarind and tomatoes
steps: Soak tamarind in warm water and extract juice.
Boil tamarind juice with tomatoes, rasam powder, turmeric, and salt.
Prepare tempering with mustard seeds, cumin, and curry leaves.
Add tempering to rasam and simmer for 5 minutes.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot with rice.

name: Pav Bhaji
short: Spicy mashed vegetable curry served with buttered buns
steps: Boil and mash vegetables.
Sauté onions, ginger-garlic paste, and tomatoes in butter.
Add mashed vegetables, pav bhaji masala, and salt.
Cook until well blended and thick.
Toast pav buns with butter.
Serve bhaji with buns, lemon wedges, and chopped onions.

name: Methi Thepla
steps: Mix flour, methi leaves, spices, yogurt, and salt.
Add water to form a soft dough. Rest for 15 minutes.
Roll into thin discs and cook on a hot griddle with oil.
Serve with pickle or yogurt.

name: Chicken 65
steps: Marinate chicken with spices, ginger-garlic paste, and flours for 30 minutes.
Deep-fry chicken until crispy and golden.
Sauté curry leaves in oil and toss with fried chicken.
Serve hot with lemon wedges.
